24  package com.dd.plist;
25  
26  import java.io.IOException;
27  import java.util.Arrays;
28  
29  /**
30   * Represents an Array.
31   *
32   * @author Daniel Dreibrodt
33   */
34  public class NSArray extends NSObject {
35  
36      private NSObject[] array;
37  
38      /**
39       * Creates an empty array of the given length.
40       *
41       * @param length The number of elements this array will be able to hold.
42       */
43      public NSArray(int length) {
44          array = new NSObject[length];
45      }
46  
47      /**
48       * Creates a array from an existing one
49       *
50       * @param a The array which should be wrapped by the NSArray
51       */
52      public NSArray(NSObject... a) {
53          array = a;
54      }
55  
56      /**
57       * Returns the object stored at the given index.
58       * Equivalent to <code>getArray()[i]</code>.
59       *
60       * @param i The index of the object.
61       * @return The object at the given index.
62       */
63      public NSObject objectAtIndex(int i) {
64          return array[i];
65      }
66  
67      /**
68       * Remove the i-th element from the array.
69       * The array will be resized.
70       *
71       * @param i The index of the object
72       */
73      public void remove(int i) {
74          if ((i >= array.length) || (i < 0))
75              throw new ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException("invalid index:" + i + ";the array length is " + array.length);
76          NSObject[] newArray = new NSObject[array.length - 1];
77          System.arraycopy(array, 0, newArray, 0, i);
78          System.arraycopy(array, i + 1, newArray, i, array.length - i - 1);
79          array = newArray;
80      }
81  
82      /**
83       * Stores an object at the specified index.
84       * If there was another object stored at that index it will be replaced.
85       * Equivalent to <code>getArray()[key] = value</code>.
86       *
87       * @param key   The index where to store the object.
88       * @param value The object.
89       */
90      public void setValue(int key, Object value) {
91          if(value == null)
92              throw new NullPointerException("Cannot add null values to an NSArray!");
93          array[key] = NSObject.wrap(value);
94      }
95  
96      /**
97       * Returns the array of NSObjects represented by this NSArray.
98       * Any changes to the values of this array will also affect the NSArray.
99       *
100      * @return The actual array represented by this NSArray.
101      */
102     public NSObject[] getArray() {
103         return array;
104     }
105 
106     /**
107      * Returns the size of the array.
108      *
109      * @return The number of elements that this array can store.
110      */
111     public int count() {
112         return array.length;
113     }
114 
115     /**
116      * Checks whether an object is present in the array or whether it is equal
117      * to any of the objects in the array.
118      *
119      * @param obj The object to look for.
120      * @return <code>true</code>, when the object could be found. <code>false</code> otherwise.
121      * @see Object#equals(java.lang.Object)
122      */
123     public boolean containsObject(Object obj) {
124         NSObject nso = NSObject.wrap(obj);
125         for (NSObject elem : array) {
126             if (elem.equals(nso)) {
127                 return true;
128             }
129         }
130         return false;
131     }
132 
133     /**
134      * Searches for an object in the array. If it is found its index will be
135      * returned. This method also returns an index if the object is not the same
136      * as the one stored in the array but has equal contents.
137      *
138      * @param obj The object to look for.
139      * @return The index of the object, if it was found. -1 otherwise.
140      * @see Object#equals(java.lang.Object)
141      * @see #indexOfIdenticalObject(Object)
142      */
143     public int indexOfObject(Object obj) {
144         NSObject nso = NSObject.wrap(obj);
145         for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {
146             if (array[i].equals(nso)) {
147                 return i;
148             }
149         }
150         return -1;
151     }
152 
153     /**
154      * Searches for an object in the array. If it is found its index will be
155      * returned. This method only returns the index of an object that is
156      * <b>identical</b> to the given one. Thus objects that might contain the
157      * same value as the given one will not be considered.
158      *
159      * @param obj The object to look for.
160      * @return The index of the object, if it was found. -1 otherwise.
161      * @see #indexOfObject(Object)
162      */
163     public int indexOfIdenticalObject(Object obj) {
164         NSObject nso = NSObject.wrap(obj);
165         for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {
166             if (array[i] == nso) {
167                 return i;
168             }
169         }
170         return -1;
171     }
172 
173     /**
174      * Returns the last object contained in this array.
175      * Equivalent to <code>getArray()[getArray().length-1]</code>.
176      *
177      * @return The value of the highest index in the array.
178      */
179     public NSObject lastObject() {
180         return array[array.length - 1];
181     }
182 
183     /**
184      * Returns a new array containing only the values stored at the given
185      * indices. The values are sorted by their index.
186      *
187      * @param indexes The indices of the objects.
188      * @return The new array containing the objects stored at the given indices.
189      */
190     public NSObject[] objectsAtIndexes(int... indexes) {
191         NSObject[] result = new NSObject[indexes.length];
192         Arrays.sort(indexes);
193         for (int i = 0; i < indexes.length; i++)
194             result[i] = array[indexes[i]];
195         return result;
196     }
197 
198     @Override
199     public boolean equals(Object obj) {
200         if(obj.getClass().equals(NSArray.class)) {
201             return Arrays.equals(((NSArray) obj).getArray(), this.array);
202         } else {
203             NSObject nso = NSObject.wrap(obj);
204             if(nso.getClass().equals(NSArray.class)) {
205                 return Arrays.equals(((NSArray) nso).getArray(), this.array);
206             }
207         }
208         return false;
209     }
210 
211     @Override
212     public int hashCode() {
213         int hash = 7;
214         hash = 89 * hash + Arrays.deepHashCode(this.array);
215         return hash;
216     }
217 
218     @Override
219     void toXML(StringBuilder xml, int level) {
220         indent(xml, level);
221         xml.append("<array>");
222         xml.append(NSObject.NEWLINE);
223         for (NSObject o : array) {
224             o.toXML(xml, level + 1);
225             xml.append(NSObject.NEWLINE);
226         }
227         indent(xml, level);
228         xml.append("</array>");
229     }
230 
231     @Override
232     void assignIDs(BinaryPropertyListWriter out) {
233         super.assignIDs(out);
234         for (NSObject obj : array) {
235             obj.assignIDs(out);
236         }
237     }
238 
239     @Override
240     void toBinary(BinaryPropertyListWriter out) throws IOException {
241         out.writeIntHeader(0xA, array.length);
242         for (NSObject obj : array) {
243             out.writeID(out.getID(obj));
244         }
245     }
246 
247     /**
248      * Generates a valid ASCII property list which has this NSArray as its
249      * root object. The generated property list complies with the format as
250      * described in <a href="https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/PropertyLists/OldStylePlists/OldStylePLists.html">
251      * Property List Programming Guide - Old-Style ASCII Property Lists</a>.
252      *
253      * @return ASCII representation of this object.
254      */
255     public String toASCIIPropertyList() {
256         StringBuilder ascii = new StringBuilder();
257         toASCII(ascii, 0);
258         ascii.append(NEWLINE);
259         return ascii.toString();
260     }
261 
262     /**
263      * Generates a valid ASCII property list in GnuStep format which has this
264      * NSArray as its root object. The generated property list complies with
265      * the format as described in <a href="http://www.gnustep.org/resources/documentation/Developer/Base/Reference/NSPropertyList.html">
266      * GnuStep - NSPropertyListSerialization class documentation
267      * </a>
268      *
269      * @return GnuStep ASCII representation of this object.
270      */
271     public String toGnuStepASCIIPropertyList() {
272         StringBuilder ascii = new StringBuilder();
273         toASCIIGnuStep(ascii, 0);
274         ascii.append(NEWLINE);
275         return ascii.toString();
276     }
277 
278     @Override
279     protected void toASCII(StringBuilder ascii, int level) {
280         indent(ascii, level);
281         ascii.append(ASCIIPropertyListParser.ARRAY_BEGIN_TOKEN);
282         int indexOfLastNewLine = ascii.lastIndexOf(NEWLINE);
283         for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {
284             Class<?> objClass = array[i].getClass();
285             if ((objClass.equals(NSDictionary.class) || objClass.equals(NSArray.class) || objClass.equals(NSData.class))
286                     && indexOfLastNewLine != ascii.length()) {
287                 ascii.append(NEWLINE);
288                 indexOfLastNewLine = ascii.length();
289                 array[i].toASCII(ascii, level + 1);
290             } else {
291                 if (i != 0)
292                     ascii.append(" ");
293                 array[i].toASCII(ascii, 0);
294             }
295 
296             if (i != array.length - 1)
297                 ascii.append(ASCIIPropertyListParser.ARRAY_ITEM_DELIMITER_TOKEN);
298 
299             if (ascii.length() - indexOfLastNewLine > ASCII_LINE_LENGTH) {
300                 ascii.append(NEWLINE);
301                 indexOfLastNewLine = ascii.length();
302             }
303         }
304         ascii.append(ASCIIPropertyListParser.ARRAY_END_TOKEN);
305     }
306 
307     @Override
308     protected void toASCIIGnuStep(StringBuilder ascii, int level) {
309         indent(ascii, level);
310         ascii.append(ASCIIPropertyListParser.ARRAY_BEGIN_TOKEN);
311         int indexOfLastNewLine = ascii.lastIndexOf(NEWLINE);
312         for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {
313             Class<?> objClass = array[i].getClass();
314             if ((objClass.equals(NSDictionary.class) || objClass.equals(NSArray.class) || objClass.equals(NSData.class))
315                     && indexOfLastNewLine != ascii.length()) {
316                 ascii.append(NEWLINE);
317                 indexOfLastNewLine = ascii.length();
318                 array[i].toASCIIGnuStep(ascii, level + 1);
319             } else {
320                 if (i != 0)
321                     ascii.append(" ");
322                 array[i].toASCIIGnuStep(ascii, 0);
323             }
324 
325             if (i != array.length - 1)
326                 ascii.append(ASCIIPropertyListParser.ARRAY_ITEM_DELIMITER_TOKEN);
327 
328             if (ascii.length() - indexOfLastNewLine > ASCII_LINE_LENGTH) {
329                 ascii.append(NEWLINE);
330                 indexOfLastNewLine = ascii.length();
331             }
332         }
333         ascii.append(ASCIIPropertyListParser.ARRAY_END_TOKEN);
334     }
335 }
